> "Never get a moment's peace!" said Salveo.  "Alright team!  To the
> comm=
and center!"
>
> The team ran toward the command center, still moving strat=
egically,
> each member watching a side of the team.


It's a rather short =
run to the command center. Along the way the team
can see more of the scorc=
hed and burned walls, some of the structure
of it has been ripped away from=
 support struts, metal twisted and
strewn everywhere. However this damage, =
unlike the damage found near
the front door appears to old, as rust has set=
 into exposed metal
surfaces. 

As the group arrives in the command center,=
 bodies of full sized
Autobots and Decepticons are littering the floor: Opt=
imus Prime,
Megatron, Soundwave, Prowl and Jazz, all of them still possessi=
ng
their Cybertronian modes. 

From under one of the control panels Lord El=
der's legs stick out at an
odd angle. "That's got it." Lord Elder says, his=
 voice muffled, yet
satisfied as the alarms shut off. 

Climbing out from t=
he panel Lord Elder looked almost surprised to see
Salveo's team, or perhap=
s it was their battle ready posture. "OH!" he
exclaimed as he activated the=
 main view screen. "You thought there was
some sort of a battle." 

On the =
view screen what appears to be a black and crimson weapons
satellite is flo=
ating high in the air, overlooking the debris of
sweeps that are all over t=
he ground. 

Lord Elder pointed at the screen, "That's just . . . ummm . . =
.
Legacy. We just met him recently. He's beginning to take care of the
refu=
se out there." The walls rock again as a blast erupts from the one
Lord Eld=
er indicated as Legacy and strikes the ground, disintegrating
several sweep=
s at once.
